alert.note: Alert for Weston (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 29 at 3:47PM MDT until June 29 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of west central South Dakota and northeast Wyoming, including the following counties, in west central South Dakota, Pennington. In northeast Wyoming, Weston. * WHEN...Until noon MDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 347 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Moon, Deerfield, Four Corners, Redbank Spring Campground and Mallo Camp.
info.instruction: Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
